meanings.definition: To develop or expand industries excessively.
meanings.sent1: The small town decided to overindustrialize, building factories on every corner.
meanings.sent2: Some countries overindustrialize to boost their economy, but it can harm the environment.
meanings.sent3: The idea to overindustrialize the playground with swings and slides was met with laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for baking led her to overindustrialize her kitchen with all the latest gadgets.
meanings.sent5: The decision to overindustrialize the quiet village transformed it into a bustling city.

meanings.definition: To make something industrialized to an excessive degree.
meanings.sent1: The company's attempt to overindustrialize the production process resulted in inefficiency.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overindustrialize traditional crafts, as it can diminish their uniqueness.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally overindustrialized the recipe by adding too many ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The artist's attempt to overindustrialize the painting with unnecessary details ruined its simplicity.
meanings.sent5: The goal was to overindustrialize the car manufacturing, but it led to quality issues instead.
